website_summaries.verdict: A popular thermos buy a top-selling brand that holds a lot of your favorite hot or cold beverages and is backed by an impressive warranty.
pros: Made of rugged stainless steel with vacuum insulation that can keep liquids hot or cold for 24 hours or longer
Has a handle for easy carrying
A lifetime warranty protects your investment and adds to its value
cons: Some components such as the rubber ring along the seal and the lid have had a few durability issues, but that's where the warranty comes in

customer_reviews.title: excellent product. we use it daily to keep water ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. we use it daily to keep water hot for mate . It keeps water at proper temperature for hours.
customer_reviews.author: paulo

customer_reviews.title: LIFETIME WARRANTY??? - cap fell off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermos due to the reputation, great reviews and Lifetime Warranty. I needed it for a trip and it arrived just in time. Now I'm on the trip and when I first decide to use the thermos, the metal part of the cap came off as if it had never been glued (see pictures). I'm absolutely disappointed. I'm still going to use it as I still have another 2 months or so left on my trip before I return, so I have no option. But it's really disappointing. Not what you would expect from a product that boasts LIFETIME WARRANTY.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: no warranty at all..
customer_reviews.text: my thermos arrived with metal nicks and burrs at the mouthpiece as well as a locked up handle which would neither collapse nor expand. i called the customer saervice warranty line only to be answered by an overseas operator who refused to honor the lifetime warranty that came on the label with the product There IS NO LIFETIME WARRANTY ON THESE MADE IN CHINA THERMOS
customer_reviews.author: valueplus

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out
customer_reviews.text: I bought my classic Thermos brand container, last September on Amazon. I like to bring my own hot coffee to work. It worked fine until this weekend when I noticed that the coffee did not stay hot. It looks fine and the top still goes on tight. It was never dropped or banged around. I can't imagine what is wrong with it. I'm very disappointed, and if anyone reading this can recommend a good replacement, please advise. It is supposed to have a Lifetime warranty, but I have no idea how to use it....
customer_reviews.author: R. N. Kemper

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product as the make suggests
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product as the make suggests....it’s supposed to keep the liquids inside hot for a certain number of hours but it doesn’t. I had actually ordered this product all the way from the United States of America to be brought back to India. And I am highly disappointed....!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise. My first Thermos since Kindergarten and I'm quite surprised at how effective it is. I put ice in it the first night because I just cannot fathom it staying cold enough to last the claimed 120 hours, or even 24 hours for that matter. After 9 hours there is no sign of melting. Not one drop of water came out. I'm impressed. I found this as a deal of the day, and paid less than $20 shipped for it. They could justify charging triple that for a product this effective. It is a very stout unit. The metal body should stand up to abuse for years, maybe decades.
customer_reviews.author: Shwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: This thermos is amazing. My husband absolutely LOVES it for work. The cap can be used as a cup and if you unscrew the cap about 1/3 of the way you can pour your drink out (there is an arrow to know which way the liquid will come out) this feature is really nice since you dont have to expose your drink to the outside air temperature. Keeps drinks warm for at LEAST 8 hours (IF there is any coffee left it is still warm) ONLY annoyint part is how long the thermos is because my bottle brush doesn't easily reach, but that is honestly the only fault I can find.
customer_reviews.author: KayMort

customer_reviews.title: Can not hold temperature just after 1 week usage.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is happening. Purchased one month ago because of its super high rating. The bottle arrived in perfect condition, no dent, no nothing. Started to use it 3 weeks after purchase. It can not hold the temperature now (just one week). I can instantly feel the heat from outside right after I pour hot water in. One day past the return window, sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Worcester

customer_reviews.title: Description say dishwasher safe, but... ...
customer_reviews.text: The product description online said the thermos was dishwasher safe, which was a large part of the reason I chose this particular one. I just read the care instructions after I received it and it says the cup and the stopper are both dishwasher safe, but the main body... not so much dishwasher safe as don't put it in the dishwasher, this will damage it. Seems sturdy, has plenty of capacity, but don't say its dishwasher safe if the main component that needs to be washed isn't.
customer_reviews.author: J Benson

customer_reviews.title: Inheritance thermos
customer_reviews.text: We purchased ro replace an antique Stanley thermos. My husband and I take road trips and prefer making our own drip coffee brand when we travel. My husband was able to design a wood fitting that fits a cone to the thermos so we can drip our coffee into the thermos. This has worked for 30 years of travel. Stanley makes a long lasting, durable thermos. You can’t go wrong with them. They are well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Tortilla maker

customer_reviews.title: Loving it! Keeps warm for the entire day
customer_reviews.text: I have the small cup which I got in Bed Bath and Beyond. My mother was complaining that her thermos was not keeping heat for more than 2-3 hours. I figured I will try the same brand as the cup I had. Bought her the thermos and she simply loves it. Tea and coffee stays hot for hours. After 12 hours it was still warm (not hot enough to brew a tea though). 4 stars because the first thermos arrived with a solid dent in the base of the bottle which made it unstable standing. The replacement arrived without dents but it still did not have a flat base which still did not made it stand stable.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsinnersoul

customer_reviews.title: Great for work!
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this is the best container for his coffee he's ever had. We bought a Thermos a few years ago and, although it kept his coffee warm enough, the black paint started rubbing off the sides almost immediately. The paint on this container is wearing well. It's a thick, strong coat that resists scratches and wear. His coffee stays very hot all day long. The only thing I wish is that it was easier to clean. The mouth is narrow, as they all are, so the only thing I can get in there to clean it with is a long brush. If it were wider though, it would pour the coffee too fast so better to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: pc honey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hot and cold well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend. I have the same one. I can make coffee at 10 am and at 10 pm coffee is still piping hot. Has a lifetime warranty. I can attest to Stanley’s customer service. I had a thermos that was not working right ( for about 2 years ), I emailed Stanley and they replaced it with a newer, better thermos no questions asked. Didn’t even have to send them the bad one.
customer_reviews.author: slabstick

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: For some reason these Stanleys are trending in Argentina, so my sister recommend me to buy one to drink Mate, a typical drink we drink down there. It keeps the water hot for a really long time. It is well made and easy to clean. Will recommend it. I never tried with cold drinks but I guess it will keep them fresh for long.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sada

customer_reviews.title: This Stanley Vacum Bottle is AWESOME!!!!  Water still HOT after 21 hours
customer_reviews.text: I tested this against 2 other vacuum insulated bottles that I had. Both of the others are Thermocafe but different sizes. I poured boiling water in each one ~ 5 minutes apart and left them on the kitchen counter from ~ 5 pm and opened them up @ 1 pm the following day. Approximately 21 hours later....Both Thermos Thermocafe bottles were cold inside......The Stanley Vacuum bottle's water was hot...not warm..but hot inside....AWESOME!!!!! The Stanley stayed at normal temperature on the outside after pouring the boiling water inside whereas the Thermocafe's were 1..Luke warm and the 2nd was too hot to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Sure it's all True..

customer_reviews.title: Keeps contents cold for at least 8 hours.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermos to use in case of power outage or emergency storm/flood evacuation. (I live in Louisiana) I plan to store my dog's refrigeration required medication in it. I tried it out with an old medication vial I filled with water. (Placed in a Zipper bag) added ice. Placed it on my porch, in the shade. The ice melted after around 8 hours. DURING A HEATWAVE! The water in the vial stayed cold for almost 9 hours. I'm sure that by draining the melting ice and adding fresh it would have kept it cold for longer. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyDogLady

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I used my Stanley thermos for years and loved it. Until I got into a car wreck, even with a big dent it still worked good, it just held 1/2 as much. So when I ordered a new one I was really disappointed that it was not built as solid. The handle came apart while I was washing it for the first time use. It definitely is not the same thermos that my grandfather used.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: This thing is enormous
customer_reviews.text: It's huge and cumbersome to carry around. If you plan on taking this to work in your lunch box or whatever I would recommend not getting the biggest thermos Stanley sells. It is very heavy and will screw with your shoulder over time from carrying it around. Even when I switched to a backpack instead of traditional lunch box it was still just a pain to lug around. I still give it 5 starts because does its job perfectly well. Your coffee will be hot for many hours and won't start tasting funny until about 7 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: plastic cap on inside incinerated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago, we used it everyday to store hot water. The inside cap part that holds the rubber gasket incinerated, releasing fine plastic powders of plastic inside with the hot water. I just discovered this today, who knows how long i've been drinking degraded plastic powder. I would never buy this again, it's not a bad unit, it's a bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Got this to keep hot chocolate warm overnight when camping. Put it in almost boiling at night. Some 12 hours later (at 35-40F temps) the liquid was still warm enough to scald. The warmth made for a nice pleasant morning wakeup. Very impressed with how warm it still was. I like that it has a wide-mouth opening, so I can fit a scrubbing brush to clean it (barely, but it fits). Lighter than expected, but seems of good construction quality.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Caution, contains hot beverage
customer_reviews.text: When I’m coming down with something I routinely steep whole rose hips in herbal tea temp/ near boiling water for 8-16 hours. I thought my last thermos bottle did a great job. And then I sipped on the tea I poured out of this thing 12 hours after pouring the not quite to boil water into it and burned the sensation off my tongue for days. It held its temperature... well. This particular version is also larger than I had thought. Standing at 14” tall (nearly the length of my femur), this is fully a utility item and I don’t cart it to the office.
customer_reviews.author: Rubblemuss

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted my very own Stanley thermos. For one reason or another mostly probably being on the two kids young poverty plan I never had one. I had over brands, borrowed some Stanley clunkers from in-laws and outlaws for road trips, but never my very own new Stanley thermos like grandpa, dad, or most of any other crew had. I'm retired now, but Then, Amazon had a $13 sale! What? Yes! Did I really need it, maybe not but I've used it on a long road trip already and it perfect. I keep it under my pillow. Don't wait!
customer_reviews.author: Rogbo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bring water with me on the golf course, where 90% of the time I walk rather than ride a cart. On hot days I like to have extra water with me in the car in case I finish 9 holes and need more water for the back 9. This vacuum bottle keeps my water cool, and it holds enough for 18 holes of golf and the ride home. I am impressed with how long it will keep water cold, too. Days. I dropped it onto the asphalt one day. It got a little ding in it, but otherwise continues to give me great performance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kozakiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Keeps water cold or coffee hot
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a few days now. They took away our water bottle filling stations at work due to COVID, and I don't like to drink the tap water (very hard water in our area). This thermos keeps water ice cold all day. I've used it once for coffee and it kept it very hot all day as well. Definitely a good quality buy and is perfect for road trips (hot water for making formula on the go!). I love the classic green--it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Durable, effective, classic thermos. Handle is a little annoying, but otherwise perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable, effective, classic thermos. I've been using it fairly often on hikes, and it gets banged around a bit, and it has still held up well, and it insulates as well as any other thermos I've used. I don't actually like the handle or think there's any point in having it, since the canister kind of jiggles when you use it. I just hold the canister directly when I pour it. So, I pried the handle off and covered the remaining metal bits with duct tape. Looks silly, but I use this more for function than form, so...
customer_reviews.author: N. Luchsinger

customer_reviews.title: Good thermos
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermos. The one complaint I have is that the metal cup part of the lid separated from the plastic part and I had to gorilla glue it back together. I recommend leaving it in the refrigerator before you take it out for the day. I also put ice cubes in it and amazingly sometimes I still find ice cubes in it the next day. This is a good thermos. Im a teacher and I like it because I don’t have to leave my work for water all the time. It stays nice and cold. It’s pretty big thermos.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: Used Standley through out my life. My daily coffee thermos died and I replaced it with this Thermos....I just put the coffee in the morning. Go back a few hours later and it is still pretty warm. But after that the coffee is not hot enough to drink and I end up tossing it all out. If I were out on a day trip, I would not have hot coffee all day. It is an ok Thermos for short time use , but if you are hoping for hot coffee 4-5 times a day, do not buy this thermos
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Just Get One
customer_reviews.text: When I was younger I always wanted a thermos where you could use the lid as a cup. I don't know why, it just seems cool! Well I recently turned 18 and finally got around to getting me one, and I'm glad I did! I love pretty much everything about my new stanley thermos, don't bother looking at different brands, this is better and has a lifetime warranty. My only singular complaint Is that the handle isn't firmly connected to the bottle itself, so when using the handle it does rattle around a bit, but who really cares about that anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Lyrik C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Keep hot water for long periods
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermo. 1. I use it to keep water hot (70 to 80 C) and it does it with no problem. 2. Long periods: normally I keep the water for a couple of hours, but some times I keep it for more than 10 or 12 hours, and it maintains the temperature without any problem. Cleaning: I only use it for hot water, so no much need for cleaning, but on time to time I like to wash it with detergent. Add water, a drop off the detergent and shake it well. No cons that I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: juampi

customer_reviews.title: Stanley is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Let me count the ways I love a good thermos! I am a repeat buyer! We use thermos and Stanley brand all summer long for ice cold drinks! Every outing we go to we take them! They have never disappointed us! We have left one sit for 3 days and the drink inside was still cold and ready to consume! Stop going in the gas stations for high price unhealthy drinks that don't stay cold. Invest in a good thermos or Stanley and keep it with you!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Grayson

customer_reviews.title: No coffee room, no problem
customer_reviews.text: I feel I single handedly prevented my wife from getting sick by letting her bring her own coffee to work and not venture into the cesspool of her company breakroom. Her coffee is hot all day and it hasn't shown any signs of spillage.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Great - keeps my coffee hot, saves me lots of $$!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is sturdy, attractive and keeps my coffee very hot. If, like me, you're sick of $3 (and more) each day on store-bought coffee, making my coffee at home works out around 40c per day (32oz large coffee is what I drink!) with good quality ground coffee. Which means in 10 days - 2 working weeks - I'd spend $30+ in Dunkin' or $20 on this plus $4 on coffee... so it's paying for itself in 2 weeks. And in a month, I'm $32 in the black! And I get to work a little easier without the coffee-shop scramble or wait for the mobile order.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: The #1 option - you really won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: The thermos is exactly what it looks like, and it does exactly what it’s supposed to. Functions better than the smaller Stanley travel mugs I own, even when I only fill it halfway with coffee. Probably a function of thicker sidewalls & more insulation. Anyway, yes it’s big to haul to the office every morning and it won’t fit in some briefcases/messenger bags, but if you’re carrying coffee for two people or for a long long day of your own, it’s the best option. It’s held up to daily use through college (long cold winters in Upper Michigan) as well as as the 9-5 grind here in NYC. I’d buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Frakes

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get any better.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used this particular Thermos for years - they had it as a deal of the day for a ridiculous cheap price so i bought another in case I ever need to retire my original unit. I have used my original everyday for work for the last 6 years - that is 1440 days of use without a single issue and its been dropped, kicked, rolled around in the bed of a truck, the bottom of a boat and what not. You cant go wrong with Stanley when it comes to this vacuum bottle.
customer_reviews.author: 1977 Walleyeguy

customer_reviews.title: Love this Thermos
customer_reviews.text: I filled this with ice and then water it stayed cold with ice still in it after two days , then filled it boiling water and that stayed hot for over 24 hours amazing product . I would recommend for any working person or just a day outing , soup,coffee,hot coco what ever it is perfect BUY IT
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Denardo Jr

customer_reviews.title: It is reliable, and it brings memories for my childhood
customer_reviews.text: It is really reliable, my grandfather and my dad use to have it and is the same color and everything, my father in law and every uncle have one, I just love it because it brings so many memories back, however as a product is awesome the coffee still hot by 9pm even if you made it at 4:00am. it does not leak. I never tough that I will buy it but with the pandemic is the only way to have hot coffee at my work.
customer_reviews.author: José

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: OK, first of all, let me tell you that Stanley seriously needs to come up with some kind of packaging, it seems like lots of units get dented, and yeah, mine came with two dents at the bottom and one on the top, I don't mind but let's face it... I didn't pay for a dented thermo and I would be in trouble if this was a last minute gift for someone else. Taking that aside, it does the job, it keeps water hot enough for about 6-7 hours (forget about the claimed 24 hours) Kind of sturdy but not like in the old times.
customer_reviews.author: PaulM&M

customer_reviews.title: Decent extra large thermos.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is an extra large thermos. Keeps liquids hot. I also bought a large extra long bottle brush to clean it. I have several older thermos bottles that were made in the USA and I have noticed the Thermos made in China are quite a bit lighter. The older bottles seem to have more or thicker insulation and keeps liquids hot for days. This thermos has no problem keeping liquids warm for the entire day. I have not tested for multi day use.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Tarnished in the bottom originally..
customer_reviews.text: And I could never clean it. The bottom became more and more gross and I could never clean it despite trying various methods. I bought a new littler different brand today. I may look less cool and carry less coffee but I won't die of some weird zombie thermos fungus disease. Plus the Stanley metal thermos gets really hot if left in a car, (my car is my precious breakroom), during the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: nowyat

customer_reviews.title: Fail!
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to be a great vacuum bottle for my coffee-loving spouse. Complete disappointment; it doesn't keep coffee hot for very long at all. We tried all the tricks; heated up the bottle w/ hot water first, heated the coffee in the microwave so that it went in extremely hot... no real good results. The max we could get decent, drinkable hot coffee out was about three hours. The replacement XXXXX Brand bottle that we ended up finding at an auction keeps coffee hot at least three times longer. I researched the heck out of vacuum bottles before getting this one as a gift. It ended up being a large disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Cory S. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old stanley with this one. It is not the same as they used to be built. I think it is made in china or something now, but it still gets the job done. Its leakproof, holds cold/warm drinks for around a days time, and is very durable. Bought this right before I left for deployment and it held me down in the winter! Hot coffee all day, and brought it back home with little to no knicks!
customer_reviews.author: Collin Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Thermos for the price
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the top, most expensive brands, but could not justify the staggering prices given my purposes. I can attest to the fact that hot coffee made early in the day, was still hot mid afternoon. Left full on its side in the front seat of my truck, this thermos did not leak. So far, I feel like I'm getting a good thermos at a very fair price - just as advertised. Lastly, both my order fulfillment and delivery went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with a smell?
customer_reviews.text: We loved this thermos at first! We got it to take on trips so our baby would have hot clean water for bottles. After a trip we let the water sit inside the thermos for two days. Upon opening it to clean it out it smelled like mildew on the inside. A very pungent and sour smell. We washed it out with soap but every time we have water in it for more than a few hours it he smell returns. Not sure what is up with that? But the product serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: The capacity of the cup is very large, and drinking water while driving is enough. One water is equivalent to another three or four times. I drink one another for a day. The inner liner made of the cup is as bright as the mirror surface, will not be stained and will not breed bacteria, it is very convenient to clean, and the material is very healthy, and it is very safe to drink water. The cup heat preservation effect is that the lever drips well, and the boiled water filled that day is still hot when it is opened the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Clayville

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Keeps stuff warm.
customer_reviews.text: Wife bought it for me for Christmas. I used it for soup when I was subbing in Kindergarten on a winter day. They always send the subs outside, I was tired of freezing my rear off during recess. I also don't always have access to a microwave at schools. This thing helped me be less cranky. It worked just as well as the one my dad used to use when he hunted.
customer_reviews.author: Lizz + Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I placed hot water into bottle to heat up the interior before filling with coffee at the start of the day (8AM). By 4PM The coffee was no longer hot but was Warm.. Warm. This was not what I expected. In other words I am not disatisfied but I am not happy. My old thermos of twenty five years kept my coffee very warm almost hot until the end of the day
customer_reviews.author: william a brown

customer_reviews.title: Easily Dented, Received 2 that were damaged
customer_reviews.text: Returned first one due to a large dent on side and bottom. If I am going to pay so much for a thermos, I'd rather it look new. Just received my replacement today, it also is dented, but only on the bottom so I guess I will keep it. Other than denting, the rest seems to be really nice. Heavy, although it concerns me that it dents so easily (from manufacturer, Amazon packaging was perfect and well wrapped). I am excited to test it out with some homemade hot chocolate and a mountain run to the snow. May update once I decide how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Jin

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking thermos.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to go ahead and start a review on this. I will update it as time passes. For now that item arrived as expected, functions as expected and seems to be a quality product. I do want to point one thing out to the seller/mfg though. Amazon provided -zero- packaging material around the item. It was in a box with nothing around it. Bouncing all over the place on its journey to me. You should really follow up with Amazon. Product is likely getting banged up because they are cheaping out.
customer_reviews.author: Averum

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used it for work and school when I had night classes. Also used it during the 5 day power outage in my home state during the wildfires to make hot cocoa and keep my tropical fish aquarium warm because the water heater was electric. I have an electric stove so I would go to my parents and use their gas stove to heat up water for me and my fish during the power outages. Ended up buying another one for my mom because she also liked using mine.
customer_reviews.author: Janella Bejer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things hot so well it's a minor logistical problem
customer_reviews.text: I put a full load of fresh hot tea in this thermos at 9am. capped it up, and carried it around until noon. Painfully hot! Had to let it cool off for a few in the integral mug, which I hadn't planned for doing. Capped it back up, carried it around, got it home again at 4:30, and--the dang thing was still dispensing steaming hot tea. A nice treat. It was still dispensing hot tea at 8pm, from a half-full thermos, when I decided I should empty and clean it for the day. No equivocation: this thing is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Bat-Radish

customer_reviews.title: Classic Stanley Thermos
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this since I received it. Keeps my coffee hot all night. I work a swing shift so need my hot coffee. I usually fill it at 3pm and get off work at 4am, occasionally I have a little coffee left over and it's still hot after a full day of work. It's tough and sturdy. My coworkers ask where I got the thermos and it reminds them of a classic camping thermos that there fathers used to use. I would definitely recommend to anyone needing to keep hot coffee or tea. I have yet to keep anything cold in it but I'm quite sure it would keep things cold as well.
customer_reviews.author: Raul B Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as a Yeti but way cheaper
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t keep ice for very long. I guess I was desperate to get another thermos but it doesn’t work as well as a Yeti thermos! I should have saved my money and get the more expensive one but the Weather here is so hot and if you want to travel it’s a nice size. I haven’t used it with hot coffee yet. It has a lot of good reviews that’s why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: MAE

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Functional and Priced Right
customer_reviews.text: I remember watching my father loading this thing with a pot of coffee every morning before heading to his cabinet shop. After at least 40 years he still carries it every day. The paint is somewhat worn off but he says it still keeps coffee hot and he didn’t buy it for looks. I don’t drink coffee every day, but sometimes I will in colder weather. I wanted something that was durable and would keep hot things hot. Since my Dad has carried this model his whole career I was sold on the product. It does what it is supposed to do and will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Every day coffee drinker
customer_reviews.text: I fill this up with coffee every morning and it keeps my coffee hot until I finish it off around noon. I do the pre heat by filling with hot water when I start my pot of coffee then dump the water just before filling with coffee. I've also dropped this more than once and it's still just like new. It's pretty awesome since it keeps me from needing to make a coffee run and spending more than needed there.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: 5 hours and nearly scalding
customer_reviews.text: I filled up my 1.1 Qt Stanley with hot coffee at 7am and then proceeded to take it with me while running errands all around town. At noon, with about a 1/4 remaining, it is just below the burn-my-mouth temperature - meaning that it would be hot enough well into the afternoon. I don't drink coffee in the PM, so I'm done with it for the day, but it served its purpose well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PShep123

customer_reviews.title: Best thermos
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best thermos I've used yet. Should have gotten one years ago, it's a tried and true classic product that obviously has worked now for generations. I was very impressed that it kept coffee hot for almost two days after not opening it since I first filled it. It keeps other drinks cold for almost a whole day if not opened as well. I would definitely buy another if I ever lost or damaged this one.
customer_reviews.author: tcole86

customer_reviews.title: It’s a classic
customer_reviews.text: These last forever. My grandpa has a beaten up one that’s not even green anymore. He said he’s had it for like 40 years. I bought this for my husband and he loves it. It’s leak proof And keeps his coffee hot for hours. I bought a bottle brush but can’t reach the bottom 😕 that’s my only complaint so hopefully I can find a longer one to make cleaning a little easier. Otherwise we’re happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy Coburn

customer_reviews.title: No Leak but average insulation
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thermos to carry liquids with no leakage. This Thermos meets that need however, not sure if the insulation is impressive. Poured hot, freshly brewed coffee into the Thermos (pre-heated with hot water) and sealed. Threw it in the back of my truck (w/camper shell-no heat) in cool/cold weather (50F) and after 8 hours in the truck the coffee was cool to warm. I had expected it would be warm to hot.
customer_reviews.author: Frest0n

customer_reviews.title: The return of a classic!
customer_reviews.text: They say “they don’t make things like they used to,” but some companies do! This is just like the classic Stanley thermos my parents had for decades. As a test, I rinsed the inside out with hot water to warm it up, and then filled it with hot coffee and left it there, unopened. Three days later, I opened it, and the coffee was still slightly warm. Three. Days. I also love the built-in drinking cup on the lid!
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: My Dad always had his Stanley with him when he traveled, at work & at home while working in the garage & backyard. I have been going though many different brands of thermoses however my memories of my Dad reminded me of the great Classic Stanley. Keeps me warm inside & out..The quality is awesome keeps liquids hot..for a long time..Now I keep my Stanley with me just like my Dad did.
customer_reviews.author: Maxluna

customer_reviews.title: Better than Yetti
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. I fill it up at 630am and it keeps my coffee warm all through the day. When I'm too busy to drink the coffee at work, it kept my coffee warm from 630am to 730pm. My Yetti doesn't come close to that. When I use it for water during my all day referee sessions, it lives on the soccer pitch in the sun for hours and keeps my water cold. Never had a problem with leaking as well. Only down side is that it is a pain to clean. It's tall and the opening is too small for my hand to get in and wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evans

customer_reviews.title: A big hit
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it myself, so I'm just assuming it is leak proof and easy to clean and hold because it appeared to be a genuine, high quality, Stanley product. I bought this for an office holiday party gift exchange game. All gifts had to be GREEN, so I picked this. It's green. It's useful. It's high quality. Several people were trying to steal it. I'd say it was a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parent

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: stainless steel one-piece design is unbreakable, and 4 hours later the coffee is still hot enough to almost burn your mouth. Love the classic look reminds me of the old days when I used to go to work with my father as a teenager. I like this so much I bought the 16oz size as well. My wife bought the large-mouth soup one. I guess we are a Stanley Classic Family now. Especially for her, this is the 3rd thermos she has tried, the 2 other brands she tried were plastic and couldn't hold the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Marco B.

customer_reviews.title: A proven classic since the dawn of time....
customer_reviews.text: Excellent time tested design with just one design flaw... the screw on green dispenser has these little ridges likely for grip enhancement - coffee residue gets caught in these they should eliminate them completely and put grip ridges at 3, 6 9 and 12 o'clock except slightly larger - like a mini mountain shape which would be easier to clean and provide a nice nub to aid turning the top
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Floriculture Guy

customer_reviews.title: Camping? Baby? Movies?
customer_reviews.text: So this bottle is good i do the next test , boiling water at 5:15 pm = Hot coffee (burn my tongue) to the next day at 9:30 am, We use the bottle so we don't need to warm water in the middle of the night for my daughter milk
customer_reviews.author: G. Borrego

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive thermos. I really never thought I’d own one because I remember it from years ago and it just reminded me of something an old person would use. Well, I guess I reached that age. It was on sale so I decided to buy. I’m so glad I did. My coffee stayed warm for most of my work day (8 hours). And the cup is very convenient. Looking forward to tying soups and more.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Going back to an office where there is no access to a coffee pot because of Covid-19. This thing has saved my life. Its huge but leek proof and easy to use. Keeps my coffee nice and hot!
customer_reviews.author: ks bradley

customer_reviews.title: Pro: keeps warm after 24 hours. Convenient as ...
customer_reviews.text: Pro: keeps warm after 24 hours. Convenient as I need warm water for next morning cooking. no touch with plastic, unless you pour water through the cap Con: cap has plastic, each time when pouring really hot water, i have to remove the cap completely, which requires many rounds of twisting Handle top has metal part and not uncomfortable when lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Bai

customer_reviews.title: Stays hot or cold longest for a portable.
customer_reviews.text: After trying out a myriad of containers to keep items hot this classic looking thermos wins them all!! The other popular brands lost 30-50% of temp overnight, or within 4-5 hours. I only filled it half full and it is piping hot upon opening! I have spent so much time toying with portable containers that looked cool or fit a cup holder. Just get this, does not disappoint!! Reminds me of my fathers favorite. I am happy Stanley makes a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vide8

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Thermos.
customer_reviews.text: Men and women in my family have been using this type of Stanley thermos for years. And now I own one for myself. Would have bought one earlier. But the price was too high. When Amazon offered it on the deal of the day for under $15. I jumped on the chance to get one. Even order one for a friend of mine. It was very happy to get one as well. Thank you for a top quality thermos at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: John Jones

customer_reviews.title: Depends on usage
customer_reviews.text: I got this for camping so that I could make coffee before bed and not have to get up in the cold. I bring water to full boil. Pour some into thermos to "preheat". Use boiling water for coffee in a thermasleeve so it doesn't cool down. Pour it in. Wrap up so it is insulated. (Overnight temps in low 30s) Less than 8hrs later, it is barely lukewarm. Sad to have lukewarm coffee .
customer_reviews.author: NONE

customer_reviews.title: Heavy weight in house flask that solves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely powerful flask that holds high heat liquid for more than 16-20 hours. I’d say it’s an amazing flask if you just use it for in house purposes. It way to heavy to carry outside. As well as for the weight it is, it doesn’t carry a lot of water. It’s sometime difficult to hold with the type of handle it is. They should do something about it
customer_reviews.author: Ashwin Kumar Nagarajan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long work days
customer_reviews.text: A 12-hr work day is tolerable with hot coffee and this thermos delivers! Keeps coffee warm all through the morning! I refill it for afternoons! This is great to travel meals too! I can put soup in it and enjoy it hours later! Cleaning is easy with a small bit of soap and water. The handle literally saves me from dropping it walking to and from work. This is a small price to pay for the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda T.

customer_reviews.title: The best thermos that I have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I'm delighted to say that I am positively surprised by this thermos. Outstanding. One morning I put coffee in there and I did't drink everything. Next morning, I opened the bottle to throw away the small quantity left - 2 fingers of coffee - to my surprise, it was still warm! Now I take this thermos to Uni every day and I don't spend the money I don't have in coffee (:
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I heated up some soup this morning - admittedly, I let it heat a bit too long and it was boiling. I started filling the bottle at 6:30 AM this morning with the boiling soup. I maybe ate 1/3 of it at work today and ended up pouring the rest out into a pot at 7:15 PM. It was still steaming. I can't think of a better review than that.
customer_reviews.author: Halifax

customer_reviews.title: Coffee and Long Days
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting a Stanley thermos for a long while. I have long days at work and wanted a thermos to fill with coffee so I don’t have to leave to purchase coffee throughout the day. I knew I wanted a Stanley as they’ve been around for ever and I remember my dad having one for years. I personally think every man should own one. I hope it keeps up for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Trucker approved.
customer_reviews.text: My brother is a trucker and chugs coffee like water. This thing is huge. He gets almost 8 hours worth of coffee in this thermos. It rolls around in his truck at least part of the time. It hasn't leaked, cracked or let him down yet. It keeps coffee hot until the last drop. It cleans up easily and preheats in the time it takes to make a whole pot.
customer_reviews.author: The Nutbarn Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep coffee hot after 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: This Themos sucks. I does not keep my coffee warm more than an hour or two. There is NO WAY is will keep things hot 24 hours as they claim. I'd like Stanely to contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Yep
customer_reviews.text: You can't say many negative things about a design that has beat the test of time. The Stanley thermos is still my go to for taking coffee to work every single day. The only negative is that it is rather loud (the metal handle clanks against everything) so when I take it out hunting I just have to use extra caution. Good thermos though, buy with confidence
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kapla

customer_reviews.title: Leaves bad taste
customer_reviews.text: Is it just me, or does coffee not taste like coffee at all in here. It taste bad! I thought maybe it was the coffee so tried again. This time I put half (same exact coffee) in a separate thermos. The other thermos tasted fine and again the coffee in this one tasted terrible! It's undrinkable! Tastes like chemicals or something. I don't feel safe drinking from here.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Favata

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my coffee hot all night.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd: one in the ‘70s, lost it, one in the 90s, recently lost the inner cap, so I ordered this one! It has changed: lighter weight, & wider mouth, which is a plus for cleaning!! Still keeps my coffee hot for 12 hrs, still warm for longer. Great product, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katee Jones

customer_reviews.title: Base a bit too soft, otherwise performs well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice capacity, with a pleasing retro design. There may be a bit too many wonky-looking plastic parts but everything still works after a year of light usage. The bottom part of the bottle was damaged in shipping but luckily the dent didn't completely deformed the base. I consider this a design weakness, since I can safely assume that somewhere in the future I could accidentally dent the base in an irreparable fashion. Manufacturing a ever-so-slightly thicker bottom would have propelled this product to the 5-stars region.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic functionality, but only one cup?
customer_reviews.text: This is everything you'd remember from a classic Stanley steel flask, but didn't there used to be an extra mug with handle? The neck of this unit has the threads to secure one, but there's only the smaller inner cup supplied - perhaps it was just faulty memory on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermos Out There
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these a few years ago, but sadly lost it while moving. That said, I was able to pick this guy up for a great price. They are completely leakproof, and do keep your beverages cold or hot for a ludicrously long period of time. You can't find a better thermos.
customer_reviews.author: Z.A. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the Stanley Stainless Steel thermos. My first one lasted for 25 years and then I lost it. This new one is lighter in weight and the handle makes pouring much easier. Also, the design of the stopper is great because it allows me to pour out my coffee without removing the whole stopper. I’m hoping for at least another 25 years from my new thermos.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well!
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase I’ve been meaning to make for over a year, and then Amazon put it on sale. I bought it and it’s amazing. Keeps my coffee warm for hours. It’s true that it works better if you put hot water in it first. It usually stays very hot for 7-8 hours so I enjoy my coffee or tea the whole work day. Excellent product that I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Harry G.

customer_reviews.title: Stanley, an excellent coffee valet.
customer_reviews.text: You can't always drink a pot of coffee right away. You CAN make a whole day's worth of coffee, put it in this, and have hot coffee all day if you do it right. Heat up the thermos first, and Stanley will serve you good coffee all day. Cleaning is easy with rinses and washes, along with the occasional baking soda cleaning. Durable, large capacity and fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Casey Stevens LeBrasseur

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed. My father kept one of these while serving in the military. Once it went on sale, I bought one. Unfortunately, the claim that coffee stays hot for 24 hours is a lie. After 7 hours, my coffee was lukewarm at best. The thermos is heavy duty and I like the stopper and cup. I'm simply disappointed that it doesn't stay hot like advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Great Job!
customer_reviews.text: This is a product made of great quality that will keep coffee hot for hours or keep an iced drink cold for just as many. With a built in cup and carrying handle, the thermos is great to have and carry along. It is well made and heavy duty and will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: ChefKronk

customer_reviews.title: Trust me this thermos really keeps things hot
customer_reviews.text: This Stanley thermos really works, I use it to take coffee on hunting/fishing trips, it doesn't leak like a lot of thermoses, and even after a long day in the cold duck marsh, it pours out HOT coffee. in the picture included the thermos had been out in very cold ( teens F ) temps in the ATV carry sack for over 14 hours- coffee was still coming out hot enough to thaw me out
customer_reviews.author: trav s

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Thermos!
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank. I take it ice fishing in subzero weather. Keeps things really hot. Tried just putting hot water in for 24hrs to test it. Passed with flying colors. Does a great job in really cold weather. Like anything worthwhile, taking care of it will make it last a very long time. That said, Mine does get tossed in with the ice fishing sled on trips. Highly recommend. Worth every penny on those really cold days.
customer_reviews.author: Clasical Affectionado

customer_reviews.title: Hot dog water!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing thermos my wife likes to drink English tea so she takes this sucker to work with her. Real heavy duty does not leak I got it on a great deal I highly recommend it I also heard people put hot water in it throw and hotdogs and then later on at lunch pull them out and make hotdogs I hope they don’t drink that hot dog water that’s disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Chunky Butt

customer_reviews.title: My dad wanted to know how I got his thermos from the 60's
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it I wasn't really impressed with the way it kept my coffee hot..then my son told me to prime it with hot water before filling it. yeah....that is the ticket for sure. I left my coffee at home yesterday at 6:15 am and it was still hot at 9:15pm when I got back home. My coworkers do make fun of me and ask me if I just came from the mines...but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray McGrede

customer_reviews.title: Nothing has changed
customer_reviews.text: The same thermos my father owned when I was growing up. That thermos was around for 20+years so when I seen this one for sale I decided I needed to get what should be the last thermos I’ll need. Very durable and holds hot/cold liquid times as posted, just make sure to run hot water in it before you decide to use for a hot beverage for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Sitt

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean but overall great
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves the handle and cup. He takes hot water to work and says it’s still warm at lunch time but not hot enough to make for instance a cup noodle. Difficult to clean. We have baby bottle cleaners at home and they do not reach the bottom however still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa C.

customer_reviews.title: Rust-free MONSTROSITY
customer_reviews.text: Absolute unit. I did not need to use mine for a while a left it in the trunk of my car with water in it for 4 months over the summer. I knew it was doomed. Yeah right! This baby looks as good as the day I bought it! So sturdy it dented my car when I accidentally banged it against the door. SUPER STANLEY FIVE STARS!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Volkov

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's made for.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed when I got this thermos. It was a replacement for a Stanley 1 Qt thermos that I lost off the back of my boat. It's not the same quality. Plastic is thinner metal is thinner and the thermos is bulkier, Just not the same quality of it's older model. But it keeps the coffee hot all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a new pocketbook
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermos. I am more excited with the thermos than a new pocket book. Holds 3 large travel cups(12oz) of coffee. Perfect for work!!! Keeps it warm all day and is super easy to clean. 5 min of hot water before you fill keeps it perfect!!! Handle slides right onto to strap of my lunch bag. No more gross community coffee machines!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure there are lighter and smaller, but I tossed 4 or 5 ice cubes into a dairy-based meal shake and left it on the counter for 12hrs by accident. It was still nice and cold and I was able to toss the shake back into the fridge for use the next day. Was not expecting that.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Cena

customer_reviews.title: HOT Coffee in a deer blind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to enjoy coffee while hunting. It's HUGE! It takes 8 cups to fill with room for creamer. The instructions say to "pre-heat" for 5 minutes, but I didn't. I poured 8 hot cups of coffee straight from a percolator the night before. Each morning, I had HOT coffee in the woods. For hunting, it is a little loud because of the handle but for cold mornings it is amazing! I had to pour the cups and let them cool off before drinking, definitely a winner!
customer_reviews.author: NRainey

product_meta.title: Stanley Classic Vacuum Bottle
product_meta.description: With all the strength and function of its bigger brothers, this half-quart thermos packs easier when space is a premium. Fully leak-proof, it'll keep your drink warm and your pack dry.
feature_bullets: Vacuum insulation keeps drinks hot or cold 32 hours or iced 160 hours
18/8 stainless steel won’t rust; naturally BPA-free

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
